title: 1980 Chevrolet Corvette

description: For sale in our St. Louis showroom is a beautiful 1981 Chevrolet Corvette. It is believed to be a 3 owner car, with the original engine and transmission still in place. The body has received one re-spray of the Mahogany Metallic paint, with everything else on the car being original. Powering this 1981 Corvette is a 350 CID L81 V8 engine with a 4 speed manual transmission. The exterior is finished in a very rare Mahogany paint. The vinyl interior is dark red in color, and matches exterior very nicely. The glass T-Tops provide a nice contrast to the red on red color combination. Considering there were only 1,092 Corvettes finished in Mahogany Metallic, and only 5,757 total Corvettes with a 4 speed manual transmission, it is safe to say this is one Corvette combination that is tough to come by today. The odometer reads 57,440, which is the actual mileage on the car. Options for this 1981 Chevrolet Corvette include: Air Conditioning, AM/FM Radio with Cassette Player, Leather Interior,  Glass T-Tops, Tilt/Telescopic Wheel, Seat Belts, Power Steering, Power Brakes, Power Windows, Power Locks, Power Mirrors, Power Driver Seat, Radial Tires, and Aluminum/Alloy Wheels. This is a great C3 Corvette to hop in and go for a long cruise down an old black top road or just down the street to the grocery store. It will also impress at any local show or cruise. To view this 1981 Chevrolet Corvette in greater detail, including HD pictures and an HD video, visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our St. Louis showroom. For more information please call 618-271-3000 or email STL@GatewayClassicCars.com
title: 1981 Chevrolet Corvette

description: With its unusually low mileage, and coveted factory-correct interior and two tone exterior still very much intact and looking good, this 1981 Corvette Coupe represents a rare chance to own a thoroughly well-equipped, numbers-matching third-generation Corvette still very much at the top of its game and ready to hit the road for a new chapter of asphalt adventure.

Because this 1981 started life just one year before the end of the run for its generation of Corvettes, Chevrolet had 14 model years' worth of time to refine the model and it shows. The sweeping curvature of the front fenders, that long hood and the sloping rear windshield combine to create a very distinctive presence.  Its two-tone factory-correct Autumn Red over Dark Claret Metallic paint job shows off that curvature to great effect. Sitting low and level to the ground, it's got a great, agile look â€“ at the time it was introduced it was one of the most aerodynamic Vettes ever built, with the drag coefficient to prove it. Sporting clean glass and rubber seals everywhere you look, you can readily see it's been well-looked after and, judging by the absence of any spider cracks in the front bumper, has likely spent much of its life indoors when not on the road. The T-top configuration is a great feature â€“ the T-tops, themselves, surprisingly light and easy to install, while providing the option of enjoying the open-air motoring experience of a convertible should you so choose ... but with substantially less wind noise should you opt for protection from the elements.

Inside, the code 74 Dark Red leather interior looks exceedingly fresh, with very little evidence of use at all. The bucket seats look plenty supportive, with deep bolsters and relatively high backs to them, and the red carpeting below shows not so much as a heel mark. The distinctive instrumentation in Vettes of this era is truly a thing of beauty â€“ that assortment of gauges occupying the center console just above the AM/FM/Cassette stereo provides an almost aeronautical look. A lot of Corvettes rolled off the assembly line with a bevy of great options included, but finding those options in good working order more than 35 years later, as is the case here, really is unusual. The A/C system cools with a lot of conviction, the power windows roll up and down without complaint and the tilting/telescoping steering column still moves perfectly. Get out on the highway and you'll find that the cruise control also performs its duties as precisely as when the first mile was logged.

Underneath that long hood, the same 350V8 this Vette started life with in Bowling Green, Kentucky sits in a clean and stock engine compartment and it seems to have thoroughly vanquished time, still running very smoothly and quietly. It's mated with a 3-speed automatic transmission that was right there with it from the beginning and shifts smoothly. Take this Sting Ray's relatively light weight, then factor in power disc
title: 1981 Chevrolet Corvette

Numbers Matching.This 1980 Corvette is actual miles and has been well card for its whole life. The engine purs at fire up and the car shifts smoothly. The wheels and tires are in good condition with no curb rash or defects. The T-tops funtion properly as well. The 350 engine has plenty of get up go. The Automatic shifts well. title: 1980 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Best case scenario. It's a 19,746 mile survivor with top flight award. It is fully loaded and documented. It is red over red, best possible combo for a Vette. The down side to a low mile car can be things deteriorate with age. Well the current owner is as fussy as they get. He recently spent $8,187.84 servicing this car. He had things done that most people would have left alone. Everything from bushings, brakes and tune up to gaskets, fuel sender, a/c service and right done to underhood light. There is nothing left to do except enjoy, everything works! Documentation includes NCRS Top Flight certificate, judging sheets and plaque. Also has original window sticker, and GM verification. Also has several pieces of original literature- manuals, brochures, etc. Also has past and present maintenance records to verify miles and the work that has been done. A few recent upgrades like tinted windows and aluminum radiator have been made. The car is in beautiful condition. The original paint is still a very bright, glossy red.  Wheels are still brightly polished, tires are new. All the trim, rubber, glass, t-tops are excellent. Interior is obviously very well kept- dash, console area looks like new. It still has the original digital cassette stereo with CB. Motor compartment is very clean. There is nothing to apologize for on this Corvette!

title: 1981 Chevrolet Corvette

description: A vintage Corvette in great shape with low miles... Too much to ask for, huh? Well, no it isn't. This magnificent 1980 Chevrolet Corvette runs like a champ, handles like a dream, and has only 47K actual miles on the odometer. The mileage is documented and so is all the work that has ever been done to the car. This local two-owner Georgia 'Vette has never ventured out of the South, and has been babied it's entire life. Cars like this don't come up for sale too often.

A walk around the exterior of this proud machine offers undeniable testimony as to why the Corvette has been the premier American-made sportscar for more than 60 years. Low and lean, it is true automotive masterpiece. You will be immediately captivated by the sleek, aerodynamic styling that has always been the trademark of the Vette. Every single contour of this car says classy and fast. Can a car be considered suave and sophisticated? We think so! At first glance you can't help but be drawn in by the rich luster of the finish. The factory original paint is Classic White in color and it shines like a new penny.  There may be a very slight blemish or touch-up in the paint, but the fiberglass is sound, and the look is certainly impressive. All of the trim and emblems are in place and showing exactly as they should. This Corvette comes with both sets of T-tops, so you'll have options when you head out onto the highway. And when you do hit the road, you'll be riding on a nice set of Goodyear Eagles mounted on factory chrome Corvette wheels.

The level of craftsmanship that went into the production of this little gem is undeniable. Meticulous attention to detail ensures that the hood, hatch, doors, even the headlight doors open and close quietly and securely with a nice tight fit. You won't find an excessive gap in any seam.. The interior is a nice saddle tan that goes great with the body color. The seats, door panels, steering wheel and middle arm rests have all been professionally reupholstered so they look like new. The dash and all its amenities are in superb condition, and an aftermarket radio is tucked inside the glove box for your listening pleasure. As you might expect, you'll have virtually every power option offered in 1980 at your fingertips-and everything works.

Under the hood, the engine bay displays all the bright, neatly-appointed chrome and polished aluminum you'd expect to see on a Corvette. This car has a brand new Chevy 350 crate motor that was installed only 3000 miles ago. It's basically stock except for the addition of a GM aluminum intake, Edelbrock carburetor, headers and a serpentine belt system. The owner really used his head on this one, saving the old engine in case a future purchaser might want to use it for a rebuild to put the car back in 100% original condition. Of course, the new engine is an upgrade and in great shape, runs excellent and is ready for many, many miles to travel. The car's TH 350 transmission was rebuilt at

title: 1981 Chevrolet Corvette

description: This 1981 Chevrolet Corvette is for sale in our Louisville KY showroom. 1981 was a year of first for the Corvette. Not only was this the first year for Corvettes to be produced at two factories but it was also the first year for the now historic Bowling Green plant. The STL plant cars were only available in solid colors while the new revolutionary bowling green plant had the capability to paint them two tone, a rather extravagant option for a production car in 1981. With the odometer showing a mere 46235 actual miles, this beauty has lived a pampered life. The bright red metallic paint brings out the lines of the 81 nicely. Under that long hood is the classic small block Chevy that came in the car backed by the original Turbo 350 Hydramatic transmission.  The T-tops are in excellent condition and have the tinted look which makes the red paint pop even more. Take them off and the wind will be blowing through hair in no time. With the black leather seats looking as new as the paint this Corvette has everything you would look for in a classic. The polished wheels are in excellent condition and are something that you just donÃ¢??t see any more. Options on this 1981 Chevrolet Corvette include; AC, AM/FM/8-track player, Glass T tops, Cruise, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Power Windows, Power Locks, Power Seats, Telescopic/ Tilt Wheel, Leather Interior, Polished Aluminum Wheels Wrapped with Radial Tires that have Raised Lettering. This 1981 Chevrolet Corvette can be seen, including an HD video, at www.gatewayclassiccars.com, call at 812-294-1555 or email Louisville@gatewayclassiccars.com for more information.
title: 1981 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Numbers matching, 44,000 miles, one-family-owned, original dark claret leather interior, automatic, rare L82/350, working R134A A/C, AM/FM/Cassette, rear window defogger, power antenna, dual sport mirrors, Monza mufflers, power steering, power brakes, power windows, glass T-tops, original air cleaner assembly, original valve covers, original ignition shielding, alloy wheels, T-Top carrier, and much more.
We drove this corvette 4 hours home; it seems to run and handle great.
This corvette has always been garage-kept and well-maintained by its original family. It has mostly original paint and original interior.

We just changed the oil and filter, transmission filter and gasket, rear end grease and additive, and checked and lubed the chassis. We replaced the spark plugs, spark plug wires, cap and rotor, and belts.

1980 was the last year for the L82 engine option with only 5,069 produced. This corvette is one of 9,907 produced in 1980 with Gymkhana suspension.  GM also only produced 3,755 with the factory T-Top carrier out of 40,614 total production that year.
- See more at: http://www.hobbycarcorvettes.net/corvette/1980-white-l82-corvette-claret-int-for-sale/
title: 1980 Chevrolet Corvette

description: SUMMARY    * Original 350 cubic inch L-81 V8  * Original Borg Warner Super T10 4-speed manual transmission  * Factory air conditioning  * Largely original Silver Metallic and Dark Blue Metallic paint  * Largely original Silver Gray leather interior  * Factory power steering  * Factory 4-wheel power disc brakes  * Factory alloy wheels  * Modern audio / Sale includes the car's original radio  * Sale includes: A copy of the car's original Build Sheet / An original Window Sticker / Service records    ----------    There's no doubting the C2 Corvette's significance in the collector car world. Like the '57 Bel Air and F1 Camaro, second-generation Vettes are considered one of the all-time great Chevrolet classics. That said, the popularity of third-generation Corvettes is certainly growing. That's why it's a great idea to get ahead of the curve by investing a little money in this striking coupe. Sporting an original L-81/4-speed drivetrain and smooth silver and blue aesthetics, this C3 is a vision of opportunistic '80s performance. And, as a well-optioned cruiser that's benefitted from solid maintenance, it's a great piece of classic car potential that's available for relatively modest money!    HISTORY/CONDITION    Sold through Weil-Koenig Chevrolet of Amherst, New York, this Chevy spent the first 22 years of its life in the hands of one loving owner. Roughly 40K miles later, the car was passed to its second owner, an Oregon native who kept it running clean and strong for close to a decade. Circa 2012, this Chevy's third owner, a New Jersey resident with a penchant for collectable Corvettes, polished the car's wheels and upgraded its radio. But, unfortunately, the collector had to downsize, and the Corvette met its fourth owner that same year. In addition to tinting the car's windows and detailing its interior, that fourth and present owner commissioned Rock Hill, South Carolina's Corvettes Unlimited to repaint this Chevy's bumpers. And today, one close look at our high-resolution photos reveals a highly original gem that, except for a few blends, features largely original paintwork.     ENGINE/DRIVETRAIN    Tilt this Corvette's sculpted hood and you'll find 350 cubic inches of original L-81 V8 that twists stout 8.2 to 1 compression into 190 horsepower and 280 lb./ft. of everyday torque. Behind that VIN-stamped mill, a lightweight Borg Warner Super T10 4-speed, an original unit that's branded with a correct partial VIN, spins a lightweight Dana 44 differential. That driveline hangs in a fully independent suspension, which combines correct power steering with correct power disc brakes. That suspension is dissected by a factory-style exhaust system, which centers a factory converter in front of polished stainless tips. And everything rolls on polished alloy wheels, which spin 225/70R15 BF Goodrich Radial T/As around correct cross-flag center caps.     INTERIOR     Open the car's long doors and you'll find a largely original interior that's been freshened
title: 1981 Chevrolet Corvette

description: 1982 Chevrolet CorvetteMUST SELL All the smog control equipment has been removed. It has true dual exhaust without a catalytic converter with turbo mufflers that sound awesome without being too loud. The front and back suspension has been upgraded to include bilstein shocks on all four corners new coil springs in front and a new 9 leaf OEM transverse spring in back. Upper and lower control arms and sway bars were sandblasted and powder coated with a gloss black color. All bushings front and back were replaced with new poly bushings. All the steering components were replaced with better than original parts. It has drilled slotted brake rotors and rebuilt calipers with new Hawk ceramic pads. Throttle bodies and fuel injection system was completely rebuilt and a new 1985 model fuel pump was installed so it now gets all the fuel it needs. It has been tuned to perfection and has plenty of power. Runs perfect. All engine components have been replaced and the compartment detailed. The AC has been up dated to R134 with all new compressor and parts.  All old parts that were removed were saved and will be included with sale. It is a numbers matching car. The original wheels with almost new tires are also included.Vehicle is located in Stonewall LA. Financing Nationwide Shipping and Warranties available to qualified buyers.
